PERSONAL_WEBSITE.TITLE: My Personal Website
PERSONAL_WEBSITE.ABOUT:
Welcome to my portfolio! I created this site to share my work and show a deeper insight into who I am and what I do. Here, you'll find a selection of my most significant projects, reflecting my passion and dedication to software development and design.

To build this project, I used my favorite technologies and those I have the most command of. I also took the opportunity to try new things that I don't usually use in common projects, such as different animations, effects and icons.

To train my design skills, I took the opportunity to build the entire layout and visual identity in advance in Figma, which I use in my day-to-day work.

My goal is not only to showcase my skills but also to connect with others who share similar interests. I believe that each project is an opportunity for learning and growth, and I’m always seeking new challenges.

Feel free to explore my work and reach out if you’d like to discuss any project or idea. I’m excited to share my journey with you!

DEBUG_COFFEE.TITLE: Debug Coffee
DEBUG_COFFEE.ABOUT:
Debug Coffee is a project I created for a college assignment where we had to develop a complete application, containing prototyping, front-end, back-end and database. The idea was to have a coffee shop delivery app, where the user can register, add their address, credit cards, search for products, add to cart, place orders, track delivery and then leave a review.

The project was developed with several modern technologies, improving productivity and a good development experience, considering that the deadline for building the project was tight (about 20 days), everything was delivered as expected.

Currently the project is still just a simulation, so all orders placed are not charged or delivered.

For now, the project is available in both the web and mobile (Android) versions. You can create an account and test it right now by accessing the website or installing the apk available in the github repository.

ONNE.TITLE: ONNE
ONNE.ABOUT:
In this project, I am the only responsible for the web frontend (Next.js), mobile (React Native) and prototyping (Figma). In this project, I have greatly developed my technical skills, as we are creating features that I had never developed before, and to explain better, here is a summary of the project:

Currently, a big problem that companies face is data protection laws. With this in mind, we thought of creating ONNE, a startup that aims to give us control over our own data.

We are developing an application that will allow you to have control over who has access to your data, and what data that is. When someone requests new data through our platform, you will receive a notification on your cell phone to approve or reject the request, choosing which data will be shared.

At any time, you can check the data sharing history and change these relationships at no cost.

With user data under our control, we share with companies only the data to which they have received access from its owners. This way, we maintain user privacy and control in accordance with the law.

Companies can access and request user data through our WEB portal or by integrating our APIs into their own applications.

The application and platform will be launched soon.

SAVEBYS.TITLE: SAVEBYS
SAVEBYS.ABOUT:
SAVEBYS was developed to support entrepreneurs who face significant challenges in recovering after crises caused by external factors, such as natural disasters. The platform connects individuals and legal entities willing to offer financial or material support, facilitating a sustainable, agile and robust recovery.

We are currently forming partnerships with companies that want to help entrepreneurs get back on their feet. We have already carried out donation campaigns for furniture, products, food and money, positively impacting the lives of many Brazilians.

Soon, we will launch our social marketplace platform, where companies in difficulty will be able to buy and sell products with special discounts, promoting collaboration and solidarity within the community.

This project was great for training my technical skills, as it was the first 'marketplace' I developed. I acted as the only frontend and UI/UX designer, created the entire visual identity of the platform and developed it from the beginning.

NEW_WAVE.TITLE: New Wave Nautical Tours
NEW_WAVE.ABOUT:
This project started as a simple Landing Page, but the client had a small issue: whenever they wanted to change the page's content, they needed someone to update the project’s code, which cost time and money. So, I added a control panel to the site, where the client can modify the text, images, icons, and information on the homepage without needing a developer.

In this project, besides working on the front-end, I was also responsible for creating the back-end and all its APIs, using PHP and MySQL to store the site information.
